class.name: PacketPeerDTLS
class.description: This class represents a DTLS peer connection. It can be used to connect to a DTLS server, and is returned by [method DTLSServer.take_connection]. [b]Warning:[/b] SSL/TLS certificate revocation and certificate pinning are currently not supported. Revoked certificates are accepted as long as they are otherwise valid. If this is a concern, you may want to use automatically managed certificates with a short validity period.

method.name: connect_to_peer
method.description: Connects a [code]peer[/code] beginning the DTLS handshake using the underlying [PacketPeerUDP] which must be connected (see [method PacketPeerUDP.connect_to_host]). If [code]validate_certs[/code] is [code]true[/code], [PacketPeerDTLS] will validate that the certificate presented by the remote peer and match it with the [code]for_hostname[/code] argument. You can specify a custom [X509Certificate] to use for validation via the [code]valid_certificate[/code] argument.

method.name: disconnect_from_peer
method.description: Disconnects this peer, terminating the DTLS session.

method.name: get_status
method.description: Returns the status of the connection. See [enum Status] for values.

method.name: poll
method.description: Poll the connection to check for incoming packets. Call this frequently to update the status and keep the connection working.

constants.constant: A status representing a [PacketPeerDTLS] that is disconnected.
A status representing a [PacketPeerDTLS] that is currently performing the handshake with a remote peer.
A status representing a [PacketPeerDTLS] that is connected to a remote peer.
A status representing a [PacketPeerDTLS] in a generic error state.
An error status that shows a mismatch in the DTLS certificate domain presented by the host and the domain requested for validation.
